ygData.subject: Re: Questions about Clarity (mana song)
ygData.msgSnippet: I ll answer what I can.  I don t twist clarity ever.  By the time we get level 32, giving your cleric, druid, or shaman healers mana so they can do the healing
ygData.messageBody:
I'll answer what I can. I don't twist clarity ever. By the time we get
level 32, giving your cleric, druid, or shaman healers mana so they can do
the healing is faster than you healing your party. Also the song stacks
with all other bards singing it in your party, and with the clarity spell of
enchanters.

Shada Silverleaf, Level 50 Bard, Mithaniel Marr
Erisi, Level 7 Paladin, Mithaniel Marr


> -----Original Message-----
> From: Benny Hung [mailto:benny@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, July 06, 1999 2:00 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: [eqbards] Questions about Clarity (mana song)
>
>
> From: Benny Hung <benny@...>
>
> Hello everyone. Recently I read a post online claiming
> that this
> song does not last for a certain ticks like all our other
> buff songs do.
> (For example, you can twist healing, jig, anthem on a good day without
> losing any song effect) However, that person claims that the
> effect of
> clarity kicks in whenever the message "your mind clears" is
> displayed and
> as soon as you stop singing the song, it no longer helps mana
> regen. Can
> anyone confirm this? I've always twisted clarity with
> healing to minimize
> downtime, but if clarity does have this rather unique
> property, I might
> have to change my tactics. I wonder why this song does not display an
> icon like all our other buff songs do.
> I would also love to find out whether clarity gives a
> caster a certain amount of mana back per pulse or double
> his/her amount of
> mana gained while medding. I have heard reports that
> multiple bards in a
> party can all sing this song to super charge mana for
> casters. Does that
> one instance of one bard song per party rule not aply to this
> song either?
>
>
